poem:
Title: "From the Shadows, Vision Derives"

In the silent abyss, young Betsey strays,
Untouched, but remade in the woodland's gaze. 
Stops not for sustenance, guards her ravenous mind,
In divination's grip, finds revelations unkind,
Her mother, fretting, in mortal maze.
In Paxton's cruel depiction, silence plays,
Of whispered horror, apocalypse's fiery haze,
Betsey in shadows, her destiny aligned.
